Conclusion and Future Directions  In this paper we propose a computationally tractable robust algorithm for sparse high-dimensional statistical estimation problems. We develop a general result, which we then specialize to obtain corollaries for sparse mean/covariance estimation, sparse linear regression and sparse generalized linear models. In each of these problems, we obtain near optimal dependency on the contamination parameter, and sample complexities that depend only logarithmically on the ambient dimension.  Future directions of research include developing faster alternatives to the ellipsoid algorithm, to further relax the assumptions in various settings, and finally to close the gap in sample complexity to statistically optimal, albeit computationally intractable procedures (Chen et al., 2015, 2016).
